fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.fs

Interface IFileEventListener

  • All Superinterfaces:
    EventListener

    public interface IFileEventListener
extends EventListener
    Listener for watched file or directory events.

    Note: do not perform any thread locking when using a listener with a watcher (for example, synchronized blocks, Object.wait() with Object.notify(), or use of Lock or related classes and interfaces). Deadlocks can occur when client code calls IFileWatcher.startWatching() or IFileWatcher.stopWatching() when holding a lock that may also be held in code invoked by listener implementations.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void fileCreated(Event<IFileEventContext> evt)
      Notification that the watched directory has had a new file added.
      void fileDeleted(Event<IFileEventContext> evt)
      Notification that the watched directory has had an existing file deleted, or for deletion of a watched file.
      void fileModified(Event<IFileEventContext> evt)
      Notification that the watched directory has had an existing file modified, or for modifications to a watched file.

    • Method Detail

      • fileCreated

        void fileCreated(Event<IFileEventContext> evt)
        Notification that the watched directory has had a new file added. The event type will be FileEventType.CREATED.
        Parameters:
        evt - the event, providing access to the file and the watcher.
        Since:
        1.0

      • fileModified

        void fileModified(Event<IFileEventContext> evt)
        Notification that the watched directory has had an existing file modified, or for modifications to a watched file. The event type will be FileEventType.MODIFIED.
        Parameters:
        evt - the event, providing access to the file and the watcher.
        Since:
        1.0

      • fileDeleted

        void fileDeleted(Event<IFileEventContext> evt)
        Notification that the watched directory has had an existing file deleted, or for deletion of a watched file. The event type will be FileEventType.DELETED.
        Parameters:
        evt - the event, providing access to the file and the watcher.
        Since:
        1.0
